diseqc_receive_timings_t Struct Reference

This structure defines the DiSEqC receive timings. Each bit received consists of 3 'chunks'. A 0 is defined as two active chunks followed by 1 inactive chunk. A 1 is defined as 1 active chunk followed by 2 inactive chunks.

Data Fields

  • IMG_UINT16 ui16ToneTolerance
  • IMG_UINT8 ui8ChunkWidth
  • IMG_UINT8 ui8MinDetections
  • IMG_UINT8 ui8PostMessageSilence
  • IMG_UINT16 ui16SlaveResponseTimeout

Field Documentation

IMG_UINT16 diseqc_receive_timings_t::ui16ToneTolerance

Tolerance value for tone detection. This is a value 0-1000 that indicates how tolerant the detection is for a single active tone cycle. The default value is 600.

IMG_UINT8 diseqc_receive_timings_t::ui8ChunkWidth

Number of 22khz cycles that define a receive chunk. The default value is 11 (0.5ms).

IMG_UINT8 diseqc_receive_timings_t::ui8MinDetections

Minimum number of 22khz tone cycle detections that are required within a received chunk. The default value is 9.

IMG_UINT8 diseqc_receive_timings_t::ui8PostMessageSilence

Number of 22khz cycles that define the end of a received message. The default value is 0x84 (6ms).

IMG_UINT16 diseqc_receive_timings_t::ui16SlaveResponseTimeout

Maximum number of 22khz cycles a reply can be absent for when a reply is expected. If this timeout is reached the operation will fail with a status of DISEQC_STATUS_ERR_RECEIVE_TIMEOUT. The default value is 0xCE4 (150ms)
